meanings.definition: A hood or cape worn by clergy.
meanings.sent1: The priest put on his almuces before the church service.
meanings.sent2: The bishop's almuces were beautifully embroidered.
meanings.sent3: The almuces made the priest look like a mysterious wizard.
meanings.sent4: The almuces transformed the clergyman into a figure of authority.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the almuces enveloped the clergyman in comfort.

meanings.definition: A fur trimming on a ceremonial robe.
meanings.sent1: The luxurious almuces added elegance to the robe.
meanings.sent2: The almuces on the robe were made from the finest fur.
meanings.sent3: The almuces on the robe looked like fluffy clouds.
meanings.sent4: The almuces on the robe whispered of royalty and grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The touch of the almuces on the robe was like a gentle caress.

meanings.definition: A type of headgear worn by certain religious officials.
meanings.sent1: The almuces completed the outfit of the religious official.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design of the almuces headgear was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The almuces headgear made the official appear taller.
meanings.sent4: The almuces headgear crowned the religious official with dignity.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering almuces headgear caught the light beautifully.
